terms.title: Terms of Use - Telegram Radar
terms.description: Terms of use for Telegram Radar service. Rules and restrictions for using the service.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.text: By using the Telegram Radar service (hereinafter - "Service"), you agree to these Terms of Use. If you do not agree with any of the terms, please do not use the Service.

description.title: 2. Service Description
description.text: Telegram Radar is a service for automatic monitoring of Telegram channels, filtering messages by keywords and automatic publication to specified channels. The Service is provided "as is" without any warranties.

registration.title: 3. Registration and Account
registration.text: To use the Service, you must:
items: Have an active Telegram account
Start working with the bot @radar_telegram_bot
Follow the bot's instructions to set up monitoring
registration.responsibility: You are responsible for maintaining access to your Telegram account and for all actions taken using your account.

rules.title: 4. Usage Rules
rules.text: When using the Service, it is prohibited to:
items: Use the Service for illegal purposes
Violate intellectual property rights of third parties
Distribute spam, malware or content that violates the rights of others
Attempt to hack, disrupt or bypass Service limitations
Use the Service to monitor content without consent of channel owners (where required)
Violate Telegram usage rules

pricing.title: 5. Pricing and Payment
pricing.text: The Service is provided under various pricing plans:
items: Free plan - provided forever with limited functionality
Paid plans - paid through Telegram Stars on a monthly basis
Payment is made in advance for the selected period
Refunds are not provided, except in cases of technical failures

liability.title: 6. Liability Limitations
liability.text: The Service is provided "as is". We do not guarantee:
items: Continuous and error-free operation of the Service
Absence of delays in message processing
Availability of all channels for monitoring
100% accuracy of keyword filtering
liability.responsibility: We are not responsible for content published through the Service and for the consequences of its use.

intellectual.title: 7. Intellectual Property
intellectual.text: All rights to the Service, including design, software, logos and trademarks, belong to Telegram Radar. You do not have the right to copy, modify or distribute Service materials without written permission.

termination.title: 8. Termination of Use
termination.text: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate access to the Service in case of:
items: Violation of these Terms of Use
Non-payment of paid plan
Technical work or force majeure circumstances
Violation of Telegram usage rules

changes.title: 9. Changes to Terms
changes.text: We reserve the right to change these Terms of Use at any time. We will notify users of significant changes through the Telegram bot or on the website. Continued use of the Service after changes means your agreement with the new terms.

contacts.title: 10. Contacts
contacts.text: For all questions related to the use of the Service, please contact:
items: Via Telegram bot: @radar_telegram_bot

privacy.title: Privacy Policy - Telegram Radar
privacy.description: Telegram Radar Privacy Policy. Information about collection, use and protection of personal data.

general.title: 1. General Provisions
general.text1: This Privacy Policy defines the procedure for processing and protection of personal data of users of the Telegram Radar service (hereinafter - "Service"). By using the Service, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy.
general.text2: Personal data administrator: Telegram Radar. Contact information: via Telegram bot @radar_telegram_bot.

data.title: 2. Data Collected
data.text: When using the Service, we may collect the following information:
items: Telegram user identifier (User ID)
Telegram username (if specified)
Channel monitoring and keyword settings
Information about connected publication channels
Telegram session data (when connecting personal account)
Service usage logs

purposes.title: 3. Data Processing Purposes
purposes.text: Personal data is processed for the following purposes:
items: Providing Telegram channel monitoring functionality
Processing and filtering messages by keywords
Publishing messages to specified channels
Ensuring security and preventing abuse
Improving service quality and developing new features
Technical support for users

storage.title: 4. Data Storage and Protection
storage.text: We apply modern data protection methods:
items: Encryption of Telegram sessions when stored
Secure data storage on protected servers
Limited access to personal data only for employees performing their official duties
Regular security system updates
storage.retention: Data is stored for the duration of your account and may be deleted upon your request.

sharing.title: 5. Data Sharing with Third Parties
sharing.text: We do not share your personal data with third parties, except in cases:
items: When necessary to provide the service (e.g., interaction with Telegram API)
As required by law or judicial authorities
To protect rights and safety of users

rights.title: 6. User Rights
items: Receive information about your personal data
Request correction of inaccurate data
Request deletion of your personal data
Withdraw consent to data processing
Limit processing of your data
rights.contact: To exercise these rights, contact us via Telegram bot @radar_telegram_bot.

cookies.title: 7. Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.text: The Service uses minimally necessary technical data to ensure functionality. We do not use cookies to track users.

changes.title: 8. Changes to Privacy Policy
changes.text: We reserve the right to make changes to this Privacy Policy. We will notify users of significant changes through the Telegram bot or on the website.

contacts.title: 9. Contacts
contacts.text: For all questions related to personal data processing, you can contact:
items: Via Telegram bot: @radar_telegram_bot

faq.title: Frequently Asked
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most popular questions about Telegram Radar
faq.notFound: Didn't find an answer to your question?

howItWorks.question: How does channel monitoring work?
howItWorks.answer:
How it works:
1. Bot connects to Telegram via API
2. Tracks new messages in specified channels
3. Checks messages for keyword matches (if configured)
4. Adds matching messages to publication queue
5. Publishes messages to specified publication channels

Technical details:
‚Ä¢ Public channels use a shared monitoring account
‚Ä¢ Private channels require personal account connection
‚Ä¢ Messages are processed asynchronously via Redis queue
‚Ä¢ Delay between message processing is minimal

channelsLimit.question: How many channels can I monitor?
channelsLimit.answer:
Plan limits:
‚Ä¢ Free: up to 5 monitoring channels, up to 10 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Light: up to 50 channels, up to 50 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Medium: up to 100 channels, up to 100 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Hard: up to 200 channels, up to 200 keyword queries
‚Ä¢ Rock: up to 500 channels, up to 200 keyword queries

What counts:
‚Ä¢ Monitoring channels (where messages come from)
‚Ä¢ Publication channels (where messages are published)
‚Ä¢ Total = monitoring channels + publication channels

privateChannels.question: Can I monitor private channels?
privateChannels.answer:
Yes, with conditions:
‚Ä¢ Requires personal Telegram account connection
‚Ä¢ Requires paid plan (Light, Medium, Hard, Rock)
‚Ä¢ Need access to channel (subscription or invite link)

How to add private channel:
1. Connect personal account
2. Get invite link to channel
3. Send invite link to bot
4. Bot will automatically subscribe to channel via your account

Limitations:
‚Ä¢ Private channels can only be monitored via personal account
‚Ä¢ Free plan does not support private channels
‚Ä¢ Channel notifications are automatically disabled

speed.question: How fast do messages arrive after publication?
speed.answer:
Processing speed:
‚Ä¢ Usually messages are published within seconds after appearing in source channel
‚Ä¢ Delay depends on server load and task queue
‚Ä¢ Average: 5-30 seconds

Factors affecting speed:
‚Ä¢ Number of messages being processed
‚Ä¢ Server load
‚Ä¢ Telegram API delays
‚Ä¢ Number of monitoring channels

howKeywordsWork.question: How do keywords work?
howKeywordsWork.answer:
How it works:
1. Bot extracts text from message
2. Checks text for keyword matches
3. If at least one match found - message is published
4. If no matches - message is not published

Features:
‚Ä¢ Search is case-insensitive (by default)
‚Ä¢ Partial word search
‚Ä¢ Search through entire message text

Example:
Keyword: "bitcoin"
Message: "Bitcoin reached new maximum"
Result: ‚úÖ Match found

regex.question: Can I use regular expressions?
regex.answer:
Current version:
‚Ä¢ Regular expressions are not supported
‚Ä¢ All keywords are searched as plain text

Planned for future versions:
‚Ä¢ Regular expression support
‚Ä¢ "Use regex" option when adding keyword
‚Ä¢ Examples: bitcoin|ethereum, \d+, [A-Z]+

exactMatch.question: How to search for exact word match?
exactMatch.answer:
Current version:
‚Ä¢ By default partial word search
‚Ä¢ bitcoin will find: "bitcoin", "bitcoins", "cryptobitcoin"

Planned for future versions:
‚Ä¢ "Search whole word" option
‚Ä¢ bitcoin will only find: "bitcoin", "bitcoin.", "bitcoin,", but not "bitcoins"

Temporary solution:
‚Ä¢ Use more specific keywords
‚Ä¢ Combine multiple words for exact search

caseSensitive.question: Is case sensitivity considered?
caseSensitive.answer:
Current behavior:
‚Ä¢ By default search is case-insensitive
‚Ä¢ bitcoin will find: "bitcoin", "Bitcoin", "BITCOIN", "BiTcOiN"

Planned for future versions:
‚Ä¢ Case sensitivity setting
‚Ä¢ "Consider case" option when adding keyword

multipleChannels.question: Can I publish to multiple channels simultaneously?
multipleChannels.answer:
Yes:
‚Ä¢ Can create multiple publication channels
‚Ä¢ Each channel is configured independently
‚Ä¢ One message can be published to multiple channels simultaneously

Configuration:
‚Ä¢ Each publication channel is configured separately
‚Ä¢ Can use different keywords for different channels
‚Ä¢ Can use different publication formats

format.question: Which publication format is better to use?
format.answer:
Forward (forward original):
‚úÖ Preserves authorship and source
‚úÖ Subscribers see source
‚ùå Shows that message was forwarded
Use for: news channels, channels with original content

Copy (copy-paste):
‚úÖ Message looks original
‚úÖ Can hide source
‚ùå Loses author information
Use for: news aggregators, anonymous channels

Recommendation:
‚Ä¢ For news channels - Forward
‚Ä¢ For aggregators - Copy with source link
‚Ä¢ For anonymous channels - Copy without link

changeFormat.question: Can I change publication format after setup?
changeFormat.answer:
Yes:
‚Ä¢ Format can be changed at any time
‚Ä¢ Change applies to new messages
‚Ä¢ Old messages are not changed

How to change:
1. Open publication channel settings
2. "üîç Message filter for posting"
3. "üìÑ Forward or copy-paste"
4. Select new format

security.question: Is it safe to connect personal account?
security.answer:
Security:
‚úÖ Session stored encrypted
‚úÖ Password not stored
‚úÖ Can disconnect session at any time
‚úÖ Session used only for channel monitoring

What bot does:
‚Ä¢ Subscribes to channels for monitoring
‚Ä¢ Disables channel notifications
‚Ä¢ Reads messages from channels
‚Ä¢ Does not send messages on your behalf
‚Ä¢ Does not change account settings

Recommendations:
‚Ä¢ Use separate account for bot (if possible)
‚Ä¢ Regularly check account activity
‚Ä¢ Disconnect session if no longer needed

code.question: What to do if I forgot confirmation code?
code.answer:
Solutions:
1. Wait a few minutes - code may arrive with delay
2. Check that phone number is correct
3. Try requesting new code (if available)
4. Make sure you have access to Telegram on this number

If code doesn't arrive:
‚Ä¢ Check internet connection
‚Ä¢ Make sure Telegram works on your device
‚Ä¢ Try restarting connection process

multipleUsers.question: Can I use one account for multiple users?
multipleUsers.answer:
Technically:
‚Ä¢ One account can only be connected to one bot user
‚Ä¢ When trying to connect same account to another user, previous session will disconnect

Recommendations:
‚Ä¢ Use separate account for each bot user
‚Ä¢ This ensures security and independence of settings

channelNotFound.question: Channel not found
channelNotFound.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Incorrect channel username
‚Ä¢ Channel deleted or blocked
‚Ä¢ Channel is private and no access

Solutions:
1. Check username correctness (without @)
2. Make sure channel exists and is accessible
3. For private channels - connect personal account
4. Try using full link: https://t.me/username

limitReached.question: Error "Channel limit reached"
limitReached.answer:
Cause:
‚Ä¢ Exceeded channel limit for your plan

Solutions:
1. Delete unused channels
2. Or choose plan with higher limit

How to check limit:
1. Go to "üí≥ Limits"
2. Check line "Channels: X / Y"
3. X - current count, Y - limit

noMessages.question: Messages not arriving
noMessages.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Channel not added to monitoring
‚Ä¢ Keywords not configured (if filtering used)
‚Ä¢ Channel deleted or blocked
‚Ä¢ Connection problems

Solutions:
1. Check that channel is added to monitoring channels list
2. Check filtering settings (keywords or repost all)
3. Make sure channel exists and is accessible
4. Check internet connection
5. Restart bot (command /start)

notPublishing.question: Messages not publishing to channel
notPublishing.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Bot is not channel administrator
‚Ä¢ Bot has insufficient permissions
‚Ä¢ Channel deleted or blocked
‚Ä¢ Monitoring channels not configured

Solutions:
1. Check that bot is added as administrator
2. Check bot permissions (should have "Post messages")
3. Make sure channel exists and is active
4. Check monitoring channels settings
5. Click "Check permissions" in channel menu

keywordsNotWorking.question: Keywords not working
keywordsNotWorking.answer:
Possible causes:
‚Ä¢ Keywords not added
‚Ä¢ Incorrect keyword spelling
‚Ä¢ Keywords not applied to publication channel

Solutions:
1. Check keywords list
2. Make sure keywords are added to publication channel
3. Check keyword spelling
4. Try adding keywords again
